intro: Campanula albovii, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, blooming in late summer to early autumn. The plant has a compact growth habit with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Campanula albovii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
